[page:AbstractSubscribeComponent] →

[name]

AbstractTextureComponent

[page:Texture Texture] - THREE.Texture

Properties - Input

See the base [page:AbstractSubscribeComponent AbstractSubscribeComponent] class for common input properties.

[property:number anisotropy]

The number of samples taken along the axis through the pixel that has the highest density of texels.
By default, this value is 1. A higher value gives a less blurry result than a basic mipmap,
at the cost of more texture samples being used. Use [page:WebGLRenderer.getMaxAnisotropy renderer.getMaxAnisotropy]() to
find the maximum valid anisotropy value for the GPU; this value is usually a power of 2.

[property:number center]

The point around which rotation occurs. A value of (0.5, 0.5) corresponds to the center of the texture. Default is (0, 0), the lower left.

The default value of centerX, centerY

[property:number centerX]

The point around which rotation occurs. A value of (0.5, 0.5) corresponds to the center of the texture. Default is (0, 0), the lower left.

The value of center.x

[property:number centerY]

The point around which rotation occurs. A value of (0.5, 0.5) corresponds to the center of the texture. Default is (0, 0), the lower left.

The value of center.y

[property:string cubeType]

The CubeType of Texture -

Notice - case insensitive.

[property:mixed data]

The data of DataTexture

[page:number number] | [page:ArrayBufferView ArrayBufferView] | [page:ArrayBuffer ArrayBuffer]

[property:string dataType]

This must correspond to the [page:Texture.format .format]. The default is [page:Textures THREE.UnsignedByteType],
which will be used for most texture formats.
See the [page:Textures texture constants] page for details of other formats.

Notice - case insensitive.

[page:TextureDataType TextureDataType] - THREE.TextureDataType
[page:UnsignedByteType UnsignedByteType] - THREE.UnsignedByteType - UnsignedByteType , UnsignedByte
[page:ByteType ByteType] - THREE.ByteType - ByteType , Byte
[page:ShortType ShortType] - THREE.ShortType - ShortType , Short
[page:UnsignedShortType UnsignedShortType] - THREE.UnsignedShortType - UnsignedShortType , UnsignedShort
[page:IntType IntType] - THREE.IntType - IntType , Int
[page:UnsignedIntType UnsignedIntType] - THREE.UnsignedIntType - UnsignedIntType , UnsignedInt
[page:FloatType FloatType] - THREE.FloatType - FloatType , Float
[page:HalfFloatType HalfFloatType] - THREE.HalfFloatType - HalfFloatType , HalfFloat
[page:UnsignedShort4444Type UnsignedShort4444Type] - THREE.UnsignedShort4444Type - UnsignedShort4444Type , UnsignedShort4444
[page:UnsignedShort5551Type UnsignedShort5551Type] - THREE.UnsignedShort5551Type - UnsignedShort5551Type , UnsignedShort5551
[page:UnsignedShort565Type UnsignedShort565Type] - THREE.UnsignedShort565Type - UnsignedShort565Type , UnsignedShort565
[page:UnsignedInt248Type UnsignedInt248Type] - THREE.UnsignedInt248Type - UnsignedInt248Type , UnsignedInt248

[property:string encoding]

[page:Textures THREE.LinearEncoding] is the default.
See the [page:Textures texture constants] page for details of other formats.
Note that if this value is changed on a texture after the material has been used,
it is necessary to trigger a Material.needsUpdate for this value to be realized in the shader.

Notice - case insensitive.

[page:TextureEncoding TextureEncoding] - THREE.TextureEncoding
[page:LinearEncoding LinearEncoding] - THREE.LinearEncoding - LinearEncoding
[page:sRGBEncoding sRGBEncoding] - THREE.sRGBEncoding - sRGBEncoding
[page:GammaEncoding GammaEncoding] - THREE.GammaEncoding - GammaEncoding
[page:RGBEEncoding RGBEEncoding] - THREE.RGBEEncoding - RGBEEncoding
[page:LogLuvEncoding LogLuvEncoding] - THREE.LogLuvEncoding - LogLuvEncoding
[page:RGBM7Encoding RGBM7Encoding] - THREE.RGBM7Encoding - RGBM7Encoding
[page:RGBM16Encoding RGBM16Encoding] - THREE.RGBM16Encoding - RGBM16Encoding
[page:RGBDEncoding RGBDEncoding] - THREE.RGBDEncoding - RGBDEncoding

[property:string filter]

The Default Value of magFilter, minFilter

Notice - case insensitive.

[page:TextureFilter TextureFilter] - THREE.TextureFilter
[page:NearestFilter NearestFilter] - THREE.NearestFilter - NearestFilter, Nearest
[page:NearestMipmapNearestFilter NearestMipmapNearestFilter] - THREE.NearestMipmapNearestFilter - NearestMipmapNearestFilter, nearestmipmapnearest
[page:NearestMipmapLinearFilter NearestMipmapLinearFilter] - THREE.NearestMipmapLinearFilter - NearestMipmapLinearFilter, nearestmipmaplinear
[page:LinearMipmapNearestFilter LinearMipmapNearestFilter] - THREE.LinearMipmapNearestFilter - LinearMipmapNearestFilter, linearmipmapnearest
[page:LinearMipmapLinearFilter LinearMipmapLinearFilter] - THREE.LinearMipmapLinearFilter - LinearMipmapLinearFilter, linearmipmaplinear
[page:LinearFilter LinearFilter] - THREE.LinearFilter - Linearfilter, linear

[property:boolean flipY]

If set to *true*, the texture is flipped along the vertical axis when uploaded to the GPU. Default is *true*.
Note that this property has no effect for [link:https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageBitmap ImageBitmap].
You need to configure on bitmap creation instead. See [page:ImageBitmapLoader].

[property:string format]

The default is [page:Textures THREE.RGBAFormat], although the [page:TextureLoader TextureLoader] will automatically
set this to [page:Textures THREE.RGBFormat] for JPG images.
See the [page:Textures texture constants] page for details of other formats.

Notice - case insensitive.

[page:PixelFormat PixelFormat] - THREE.PixelFormat
[page:AlphaFormat AlphaFormat] - THREE.AlphaFormat - AlphaFormat, Alpha
[page:RedFormat RedFormat] - THREE.RedFormat - RedFormat, Red
[page:RedIntegerFormat RedIntegerFormat] - THREE.RedIntegerFormat - RedIntegerFormat, RedInteger
[page:RGFormat RGFormat] - THREE.RGFormat - RGFormat, RG
[page:RGIntegerFormat RGIntegerFormat] - THREE.RGIntegerFormat - RGIntegerFormat, RGInteger
[page:RGBFormat RGBFormat] - THREE.RGBFormat - RGBFormat, RGB
[page:RGBIntegerFormat RGBIntegerFormat] - THREE.RGBIntegerFormat - RGBIntegerFormat, RGBInteger
[page:RGBAIntegerFormat RGBAIntegerFormat] - THREE.RGBAIntegerFormat - RGBAIntegerFormat, RGBAInteger
[page:LuminanceFormat LuminanceFormat] - THREE.LuminanceFormat - LuminanceFormat, Luminance
[page:LuminanceAlphaFormat LuminanceAlphaFormat] - THREE.LuminanceAlphaFormat - LuminanceAlphaFormat, LuminanceAlpha
[page:RGBEFormat RGBEFormat] - THREE.RGBEFormat - RGBEFormat, RGBE
[page:DepthFormat DepthFormat] - THREE.DepthFormat - DepthFormat, Depth
[page:DepthStencilFormat DepthStencilFormat] - THREE.DepthStencilFormat - DepthStencilFormat, DepthStencil
[page:RGBAFormat RGBAFormat] - THREE.RGBAFormat - RGBAFormat, RGBA

[property:boolean generateMipmaps]

Whether to generate mipmaps (if possible) for a texture. True by default. Set this to false if you are
creating mipmaps manually.

[property:number height]

Input of abstract texture component

[property:string loaderType]

The LoadType of Texture - video, image etc

Notice - case insensitive.

[property:string magFilter]

How the texture is sampled when a texel covers more than one pixel. The default is
[page:Textures THREE.LinearFilter], which takes the four closest texels and bilinearly interpolates among them.
The other option is [page:Textures THREE.NearestFilter], which uses the value of the closest texel.
See the [page:Textures texture constants] page for details.

Notice - case insensitive.

[page:TextureFilter TextureFilter] - THREE.TextureFilter
[page:NearestFilter NearestFilter] - THREE.NearestFilter - NearestFilter, Nearest
[page:NearestMipmapNearestFilter NearestMipmapNearestFilter] - THREE.NearestMipmapNearestFilter - NearestMipmapNearestFilter, nearestmipmapnearest
[page:NearestMipmapLinearFilter NearestMipmapLinearFilter] - THREE.NearestMipmapLinearFilter - NearestMipmapLinearFilter, nearestmipmaplinear
[page:LinearMipmapNearestFilter LinearMipmapNearestFilter] - THREE.LinearMipmapNearestFilter - LinearMipmapNearestFilter, linearmipmapnearest
[page:LinearMipmapLinearFilter LinearMipmapLinearFilter] - THREE.LinearMipmapLinearFilter - LinearMipmapLinearFilter, linearmipmaplinear
[page:LinearFilter LinearFilter] - THREE.LinearFilter - Linearfilter, linear

[property:string mapping]

How the image is applied to the object. An object type of [page:Textures THREE.UVMapping] is the default,
where the U,V coordinates are used to apply the map.
See the [page:Textures texture constants] page for other mapping types.

Notice - case insensitive.

[page:UVMapping UVMapping] - THREE.UVMapping - UVMapping, uv
[page:CubeReflectionMapping CubeReflectionMapping] - THREE.CubeReflectionMapping - CubeReflectionMapping, cubereflection
[page:CubeRefractionMapping CubeRefractionMapping] - THREE.CubeRefractionMapping - CubeRefractionMapping, cuberefraction
[page:EquirectangularReflectionMapping EquirectangularReflectionMapping] - THREE.EquirectangularReflectionMapping - EquirectangularReflectionMapping, equirectangularreflection
[page:EquirectangularRefractionMapping EquirectangularRefractionMapping] - THREE.EquirectangularRefractionMapping - EquirectangularRefractionMapping, equirectangularrefraction
[page:CubeUVReflectionMapping CubeUVReflectionMapping] - THREE.CubeUVReflectionMapping - CubeUVReflectionMapping, cubeuvreflection
[page:CubeUVRefractionMapping CubeUVRefractionMapping] - THREE.CubeUVRefractionMapping - CubeUVRefractionMapping, cubeuvrefraction
[page:Texture Texture] - THREE.Texture.DEFAULT_MAPPING - default

[property:string minFilter]

How the texture is sampled when a texel covers less than one pixel. The default is
[page:Textures THREE.LinearMipmapLinearFilter], which uses mipmapping and a trilinear filter.
See the [page:Textures texture constants] page for all possible choices.

Notice - case insensitive.

[page:TextureFilter TextureFilter] - THREE.TextureFilter
[page:NearestFilter NearestFilter] - THREE.NearestFilter - NearestFilter, Nearest
[page:NearestMipmapNearestFilter NearestMipmapNearestFilter] - THREE.NearestMipmapNearestFilter - NearestMipmapNearestFilter, nearestmipmapnearest
[page:NearestMipmapLinearFilter NearestMipmapLinearFilter] - THREE.NearestMipmapLinearFilter - NearestMipmapLinearFilter, nearestmipmaplinear
[page:LinearMipmapNearestFilter LinearMipmapNearestFilter] - THREE.LinearMipmapNearestFilter - LinearMipmapNearestFilter, linearmipmapnearest
[page:LinearMipmapLinearFilter LinearMipmapLinearFilter] - THREE.LinearMipmapLinearFilter - LinearMipmapLinearFilter, linearmipmaplinear
[page:LinearFilter LinearFilter] - THREE.LinearFilter - Linearfilter, linear

[property:string name]

The name of the object (doesn't need to be unique). Default is an empty string.

[property:number offset]

How much a single repetition of the texture is offset from the beginning, in each direction U and V.
Typical range is *0.0* to *1.0*.

The default value of offsetX, offsetY

[property:number offsetX]

How much a single repetition of the texture is offset from the beginning, in each direction U and V.
Typical range is *0.0* to *1.0*.

The value of offset.x

[property:number offsetY]

How much a single repetition of the texture is offset from the beginning, in each direction U and V.
Typical range is *0.0* to *1.0*.

The value of offset.y

[property:boolean premultiplyAlpha]

If set to *true*, the alpha channel, if present, is multiplied into the color channels when the texture is uploaded to the GPU. Default is *false*.
Note that this property has no effect for [link:https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ImageBitmap ImageBitmap].
You need to configure on bitmap creation instead. See [page:ImageBitmapLoader].

[property:any programMipmaps][]

Input of abstract texture component

[property:any programParam]

Input of abstract texture component

[property:number repeat]

How many times the texture is repeated across the surface, in each direction U and V. If repeat is set
greater than 1 in either direction, the corresponding Wrap parameter should also be set to
[page:Textures THREE.RepeatWrapping] or [page:Textures THREE.MirroredRepeatWrapping] to achieve the desired
tiling effect. Setting different repeat values for textures is restricted in the same way like [page:.offset].

The default value of repeatX , repeatY

[property:number repeatX]

How many times the texture is repeated across the surface, in each direction U and V. If repeat is set
greater than 1 in either direction, the corresponding Wrap parameter should also be set to
[page:Textures THREE.RepeatWrapping] or [page:Textures THREE.MirroredRepeatWrapping] to achieve the desired
tiling effect. Setting different repeat values for textures is restricted in the same way like [page:.offset].

The value of repeat.x

[property:number repeatY]

How many times the texture is repeated across the surface, in each direction U and V. If repeat is set
greater than 1 in either direction, the corresponding Wrap parameter should also be set to
[page:Textures THREE.RepeatWrapping] or [page:Textures THREE.MirroredRepeatWrapping] to achieve the desired
tiling effect. Setting different repeat values for textures is restricted in the same way like [page:.offset].

The value of repeat.y

[property:number rotation]

How much the texture is rotated around the center point, in radians. Positive values are counter-clockwise. Default is *0*.

[property:string text]

The Texture param use when call Canvas Program.

[property:string type]

The Type of Texture of Matrial

[property:number unpackAlignment]

4 by default. Specifies the alignment requirements for the start of each pixel row in memory.
The allowable values are 1 (byte-alignment), 2 (rows aligned to even-numbered bytes),
4 (word-alignment), and 8 (rows start on double-word boundaries).
See [link:http://www.khronos.org/opengles/sdk/docs/man/xhtml/glPixelStorei.xml glPixelStorei]
for more information.

[property:number width]

Input of abstract texture component

[property:string wrap]

This defines how the texture is wrapped horizontally and corresponds to *U* in UV mapping.
The default is [page:Textures THREE.ClampToEdgeWrapping], where the edge is clamped to the outer edge texels.
The other two choices are [page:Textures THREE.RepeatWrapping] and [page:Textures THREE.MirroredRepeatWrapping].
See the [page:Textures texture constants] page for details.

The Default Value of wrapS, wrapT.

Notice - case insensitive.

[page:RepeatWrapping RepeatWrapping] - THREE.RepeatWrapping - RepeatWrapping, wraprepeat, repeat
[page:MirroredRepeatWrapping MirroredRepeatWrapping] - THREE.MirroredRepeatWrapping - MirroredRepeatWrapping, mirroredrepeat
[page:ClampToEdgeWrapping ClampToEdgeWrapping] - THREE.ClampToEdgeWrapping - ClampToEdgeWrapping, clamptoedge

[property:string wrapS]

This defines how the texture is wrapped horizontally and corresponds to *U* in UV mapping.
The default is [page:Textures THREE.ClampToEdgeWrapping], where the edge is clamped to the outer edge texels.
The other two choices are [page:Textures THREE.RepeatWrapping] and [page:Textures THREE.MirroredRepeatWrapping].
See the [page:Textures texture constants] page for details.

Notice - case insensitive.

[page:RepeatWrapping RepeatWrapping] - THREE.RepeatWrapping - RepeatWrapping, wraprepeat, repeat
[page:MirroredRepeatWrapping MirroredRepeatWrapping] - THREE.MirroredRepeatWrapping - MirroredRepeatWrapping, mirroredrepeat
[page:ClampToEdgeWrapping ClampToEdgeWrapping] - THREE.ClampToEdgeWrapping - ClampToEdgeWrapping, clamptoedge

[property:string wrapT]

This defines how the texture is wrapped vertically and corresponds to *V* in UV mapping.
The same choices are available as for [property:number wrapS].
NOTE: tiling of images in textures only functions if image dimensions are powers of two
(2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128, 256, 512, 1024, 2048, ...) in terms of pixels.
Individual dimensions need not be equal, but each must be a power of two.
This is a limitation of WebGL, not three.js.

Notice - case insensitive.

[page:RepeatWrapping RepeatWrapping] - THREE.RepeatWrapping - RepeatWrapping, wraprepeat, repeat
[page:MirroredRepeatWrapping MirroredRepeatWrapping] - THREE.MirroredRepeatWrapping - MirroredRepeatWrapping, mirroredrepeat
[page:ClampToEdgeWrapping ClampToEdgeWrapping] - THREE.ClampToEdgeWrapping - ClampToEdgeWrapping, clamptoedge
